The BioCatalogue REST API - Endpoints Detailed Docs

Back to Main API docs page

Back to Table of Endpoints

It is recommended that you have a look at the information about the data model exposed by the REST API before utilising the endpoints.

GET /

OR: /api

The root resource that provides information on the API.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/api.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<biocatalogue xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/" resourceType="BioCatalogue" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.biocatalogue.org/2009/xml/rest http://www.biocatalogue.org/2009/xml/rest/schema-v1.xsd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:title="The BioCatalogue" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="http://www.biocatalogue.org/2009/xml/rest" xmlns:dcterms="http://purl.org/dc/terms/">
  <documentation xlink:href="http://apidocs.biocatalogue.org" xlink:title="Documentation for the BioCatalogue APIs"/>
  <collections>
    <agents xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/agents" resourceType="Agents" xlink:title="Agents index"/>
    <annotationAttributes xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotation_attributes" resourceType="AnnotationAttributes" xlink:title="Annotation Attributes index"/>
    <annotations xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations" resourceType="Annotations" xlink:title="Annotations index"/>
    <categories xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories" resourceType="Categories" xlink:title="Categories index"/>
    <registries xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/registries" resourceType="Registries" xlink:title="Registries index"/>
    <restMethods xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_methods" resourceType="RestMethods" xlink:title="REST Methods index"/>
    <restResources xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_resources" resourceType="RestResources" xlink:title="REST Resources index"/>
    <restServices xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_services" resourceType="RestServices" xlink:title="REST Services index"/>
    <search xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/search" resourceType="Search" xlink:title="Search everything in the BioCatalogue"/>
    <serviceProviders xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_providers" resourceType="ServiceProviders" xlink:title="Service Providers index"/>
    <services xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services" resourceType="Services" xlink:title="Services index"/>
    <soapOperations xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_operations" resourceType="SoapOperations" xlink:title="SOAP operations index"/>
    <soapServices xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services" resourceType="SoapServices" xlink:title="SOAP Services index"/>
    <tags xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/tags" resourceType="Tags" xlink:title="Tags index"/>
    <testResults xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/test_results" resourceType="TestResults" xlink:title="Test Results index"/>
    <users xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/users" resourceType="Users" xlink:title="Users index"/>
    <filters>
      <annotations xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations/filters" resourceType="Filters" xlink:title="Filters for the annotations index"/>
      <restMethods xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_methods/filters" resourceType="Filters" xlink:title="Filters for the REST methods index"/>
      <services xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/filters" resourceType="Filters" xlink:title="Filters for the services index"/>
      <soapOperations xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_operations/filters" resourceType="Filters" xlink:title="Filters for the SOAP operations index"/>
    </filters>
  </collections>
</biocatalogue>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/api.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "biocatalogue": {
        "collections": [
            {
                "agents": {
                    "resource_type": "Agents",
                    "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/agents",
                    "description": "Agents index"
                }
            },
            {
                "annotation_attributes": {
                    "resource_type": "AnnotationAttributes",
                    "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotation_attributes",
                    "description": "Annotation attributes index"
                }
            },
            ... ,
            {
                "filters": [
                    {
                        "services": {
                            "resource_type": "Filters",
                            "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/filters",
                            "description": "Filters for the services index"
                        }
                    },
			...
                ]
            }
        ],
        "documentation": {
            "resource": "http://apidocs.biocatalogue.org",
            "description": "Documentation for the BioCatalogue APIs"
        }
    }
}

Back to Table of Endpoints

GET /search?q={query}

Keyword/query search to retrieve relevant Service, SoapOperation, ServiceProvider, User and Registry resources.

Note: the following characters have special meaning when used in a search query (used to pattern match in the search engine): \, +, -, !, (, ), :, ^, ], {, }, ~, *, ?

To search for these characters literally, warp your query in double quotes.

For example, to search for a service that has the WSDL URL "http://ws.adaptivedisclosure.org/axis/services/SearcherWS?wsdl" (which has a question mark in it):

http://www.biocatalogue.org/search.xml?q=%22http%3a%2f%2fws.adaptivedisclosure.org%2faxis%2fservices%2fSearcherWS%3fwsdl%22

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/search.xml?q=dbfetch

Output Snippet (XML): 

<search xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/search?q=dbfetch" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.biocatalogue.org/2009/xml/rest http://www.biocatalogue.org/2009/xml/rest/schema-v1.xsd" resourceType="Search">  <parameters>
    <query urlKey="q">dbfetch</query>
    <scope urlValue="all" urlKey="scope">All</scope>
    <page urlKey="page">1</page>
    <pageSize urlKey="per_page">10</pageSize>
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    <pages>3</pages>
    <results>30</results>
    <scopedResults scope="Services">8</scopedResults>
    <scopedResults scope="Soap Operations">22</scopedResults>
    ...
  </statistics>
  <results>
    <service xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/608" resourceType="Service" xlink:title="Service - DBFetch">
      ...
    </service>
    <soapOperation xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_operations/607" resourceType="SoapOperation" xlink:title="Soap Operation - fetchData">
      ...
    </soapOperation>
    ...
  </results>
  <related>
    <next xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/search?page=2&q=dbfetch" resourceType="Search" xlink:title="Next page of results"/>
    <searches>
      <scoped xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/search?q=dbfetch&scope=services" scope="Services" xlink:title="Search results for Services" resourceType="Search"/>
      ...
    </searches>
  </related>
</search>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/search.json?q=dbfetch

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "search": {
        "results": [
            {
                "name": "dbfetch",
                "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/2190",
                "latest_monitoring_status": {
                    "message": "All tests were successful for this service",
                    "symbol": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/images/tick-sphere-50.png",
                    "small_symbol": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/images/small-tick-sphere-50.png",
                    "last_checked": "2010-05-17T04:30:45Z",
                    "label": "PASSED"
                }, 
                ...
            },
            ...
        ],
        "total": 10,
        "per_page": 10,
        "search_query": "dbfetch",
        "pages": 1,
        "current_page": 1
    }
}

Back to Table of Endpoints

GET /lookup

A special API endpoint to find one particular thing based on some criteria. This endpoint is avaialable in HTML, XML, and JSON representations.

Currently used to retrieve:

Resource Required URL Query Parameters
SoapService wsdl_location
SoapOperation wsdl_location, operation_name
SoapInput wsdl_location, operation_name, input_name
SoapOutput wsdl_location, operation_name, output_name

Note: at the moment this assumes that there is one and only one result that can be redirected to (via an HTTP 302). However, this may not always be the case and so a future consideration will be to potentially use HTTP 300 redirects to specify that multiple items have been found.

Output Formats: depends on the resource that you are redirected to.

Example URL: Get a specific SoapOperation - http://www.biocatalogue.org/lookup?wsdl_location=http://ws.adaptivedisclosure.org/axis/services/IndexWS?wsdl&operation_name=streamContent

Redirects to: http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_operations/15176

Back to Table of Endpoints

GET /services

Services index/collection resource.

A Service is the main resource type in the system, and is the container for all things to do with a particular service registered in the BioCatalogue. This includes variants (SoapService and/or RestService), ServiceDeployments, ServiceTests and so on.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/services.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<services resourceType="Services" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services" ...>
  <parameters>
    <filters>
    </filters>
    <query urlKey="q"></query>
    <sortBy urlKey="sort_by" urlValue="created">Created at date</sortBy>
    <sortOrder urlKey="sort_order" urlValue="desc">Descending</sortOrder>
    <page urlKey="page">1</page>
    <pageSize urlKey="per_page">10</pageSize>
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    <pages>163</pages>
    <results>1627</results>
    <total>1627</total>
  </statistics>
  <results>
    <service resourceType="Service" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/2623" xlink:title="Service - G-language SOAP Service">
      <dc:title>Service - G-language SOAP Service</dc:title>
      <name>G-language SOAP Service</name>
      ...    
    </service>
  </results>
  <related>
    <next resourceType="Services" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services?page=2" xlink:title="Next page of results"/>
    <filters resourceType="Filters" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/filters" xlink:title="Filters for the services index"/>
    ...  
  </related>
</services>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/services.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "services": {
        "results": [
            {
                "name": "myExample",
                "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/2640",
                "service_technology_types": [
                    "REST"
                ],
                ...
            },
            ...
        ],
        "sort_order": "desc",
        "sort_by": "created",
        "total": 1632,
        "per_page": 10,
        "search_query": null,
        "pages": 164,
        "current_page": 1
    }
}

Back to Table of Endpoints

GET /services/filters

Filters that can be applied to the Services index. These include filters for categories, tags, countries, submitters and service providers.

Key Filters By
cat Service Categories
t Service Types
p Service Providers
su Submitting Users
sr Submitting Registries
tag Tags
tag_s Tags (on Services)
tag_ops Tags (on Operations)
tag_rms Tags (on REST Methods)
tag_ins Tags (on Inputs)
tag_outs Tags (on Outputs)
c Country (Location)

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/filters.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<filters resourceType="Filters" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/Services/filters" ...>
  <group name="Service Categories">
    <type name="Service Categories" description="" urlKey="cat">
      <filter resourceType="Services" name="Sequence Analysis" ...>
        ...
      </filter>
    </type>
  </group>
</filters>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/filters.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

[
    {
        "group": {
            "filter_types": [
                {
                    "filter_type": {
                        "name": "Service Types",
                        "filters": [
                            {
                                "filter": {
                                    "name": "SOAP",
                                    "id": "SOAP",
                                    "count": 1583
                                }
                            },
                            {
                                "filter": {
                                    "name": "REST",
                                    "id": "REST",
                                    "count": 49
                                }
                            }
                        ],
                        "description": "",
                        "url_key": "t"
                    }
                }
            ],
            "name": "Service Types"
        }
    },
    ...
]

GET /services/{id}

Details about a specific Service.

A Service is the main resource type in the system, and is the container for all things to do with a particular service registered in the BioCatalogue. This includes variants (SoapService and/or RestService), ServiceDeployments, ServiceTests and so on.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<service resourceType="Service" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" ...>
  <dc:title>Service - DBFetch</dc:title>
  <name>DBFetch</name>
  <originalSubmitter resourceType="User" resourceName="Rodrigo Lopez" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/26" xlink:title="Member - Rodrigo Lopez"/>
  ...
</service>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "service": {
        "name": "DBFetch",
        "self": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4",
        "submitter": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/26",
        "service_technology_types": [
            "SOAP"
        ],
        "description": "WSDbfetch: Database entry retrieval using entry identifiers (see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/dbfetch)",
        "latest_monitoring_status": {
            "message": "All tests were successful for this service",
            "symbol": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/images/tick-sphere-50.png",
            "small_symbol": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/images/small-tick-sphere-50.png",
            "last_checked": "2010-05-17T04:00:24Z",
            "label": "PASSED"
        },
        ...
    }
}

GET /services/{id}/summary

A metadata summary of a specific Service.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4/summary.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<service xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" ...>
  <dc:title>Service - DBFetch</dc:title>
  <name>DBFetch</name>
  ...
  <summary xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4/summary" resourceType="Service">
    <counts>
      <deployments>1</deployments>
      <variants>1</variants>
      <metadata by="users">94</metadata>
      ...
    </counts>
    <alternativeName>WSDbfetch (SOAP)</alternativeName>
    ...
    <location>
      <city></city>
      <country>United Kingdom</country>
      <iso3166CountryCode>GB</iso3166CountryCode>
      <flag xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/images/flags/gb.png?1267710900" xlink:title="Flag icon for this location"></flag>
    </location>
    <documentationUrl>http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/dbfetch</documentationUrl>
    ...
  </summary>
  <related>
    ...
  </related>
</service>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4/summary.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "service": {
        "name": "DBFetch",
        "self": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4",
        "summary": {
            "publications": [
                "http://nar.oxfordjournals.org/cgi/content/abstract/gkm291v1?ijkey=HLk7PzQHQ2C7dmC&keytype=ref\r\n\r\nPMID: 17576686\r\n\r\ndoi:10.1093/nar/gkm291\r\n"
            ],
            "citations": [
 
            ],
            "descriptions": [
                "WSDbfetch: Database entry retrieval using entry identifiers (see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/dbfetch)",
                "The service retrieves entries (sequences, literature abstract, protein structure information, etc) from various up-to-date biological databases using databases entry identifiers or accession numbers. \r\nSupported databases (complete list can be found on the web interface): EMBL, Ensembl, UniProt, UniRef, UniSave, RefSeq, Medline, PDB, InterPro, HGVbase, GenomeReviews, interPro.  \r\n\r\nWeb interface: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/cgi-bin/dbfetch\r\n\r\n"
            ],
            "cost": [
                "Free.\r\n"
            ],
            ...
        },
        ...
    }
}

GET /services/{id}/deployments

ServiceDeployments for a specific Service.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4/deployments.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<service resourceType="Service" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4" ...>
  <dc:title>Service - DBFetch</dc:title>
  <name>DBFetch</name>
  ...
  <deployments resourceType="Service" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4/deployments">
    <serviceDeployment resourceType="ServiceDeployment" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_deployments/4">
      <endpoint>http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ws/services/WSDbfetch</endpoint>
      <serviceProvider resourceType="ServiceProvider" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_providers/1" xlink:title="Service Provider - European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI)">
        <dc:title>Service Provider - European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI)</dc:title>
        <name>European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI)</name>
        ...
      </serviceProvider>
      <location>
        <city></city>
        <country>United Kingdom</country>
        <iso3166CountryCode>GB</iso3166CountryCode>
        <flag xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/images/flags/gb.png?1267710900" xlink:title="Flag icon for this location"></flag>
      </location>
      <submitter resourceType="User" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/26" resourceName="Rodrigo Lopez" xlink:title="Member - Rodrigo Lopez"/>
      <dcterms:created>2008-11-14T12:05:19Z</dcterms:created>
    </serviceDeployment>
  </deployments>
  <related>
    ...
  </related>
</service>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4/deployments.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "service": {
        "name": "DBFetch",
        "self": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4",

                    "city": null,

                }
            }
        ],
        ...
    }
}

GET /services/{id}/variants

Variants (i.e.: SOAP and/or REST) for a specific Service.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4/variants.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<service xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4" ...>
  <dc:title>Service - DBFetch</dc:title>
  <name>DBFetch</name>
  ...
  <serviceTechnologyTypes>
    <type>SOAP</type>
  </serviceTechnologyTypes>
  <latestMonitoringStatus>
    <label>PASSED</label>
    <message>All tests were successful for this service</message>
    ...
  </latestMonitoringStatus>
  <dcterms:created>2008-11-14T12:05:19Z</dcterms:created>
  <variants xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4/variants" resourceType="Service">
    <soapService xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services/4" resourceType="SoapService" xlink:title="Soap Service - WSDBFetchServerLegacyService">
      <dc:title>Soap Service - WSDBFetchServerLegacyService</dc:title>
      <name>WSDBFetchServerLegacyService</name>
      ...
    </soapService>
  </variants>
  <related>
    ...
  </related>
</service>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4/variants.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "service": {

            "SOAP"
        ],
        "description": "WSDbfetch: Database entry retrieval using entry identifiers (see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/dbfetch)",
        "variants": [
            {
                "name": "WSDBFetchServerLegacyService",
                "submitter": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/26",
                "documentation_url": "http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/dbfetch",
                "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services/4",
                "wsdl_location": "http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/wsdl/WSDbfetch.wsdl",
                "description": "WSDbfetch: Database entry retrieval using entry identifiers (see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/dbfetch)",
                "created_at": "2008-11-14T12:05:15Z"
            }
        ],
        "latest_monitoring_status": {
            "message": "All tests were successful for this service",
            "symbol": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/images/tick-sphere-50.png",
            "small_symbol": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/images/small-tick-sphere-50.png",
            "last_checked": "2010-05-17T04:00:24Z",
            "label": "PASSED"
        },
        "created_at": "2008-11-14T12:05:19Z"
    }
}

GET /services/{id}/monitoring

Monitoring details for a specific Service.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4/monitoring.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<service xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4" ...>
  <dc:title>Service - DBFetch</dc:title>
  <name>DBFetch</name>
  ...
  <latestMonitoringStatus>
    <label>PASSED</label>
    <message>All tests were successful for this service</message>
    <symbol xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/images/tick-sphere-50.png?1267710902".../>
    <smallSymbol xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/images/small-tick-sphere-50.png?1267710902" .../>
    <lastChecked>2010-04-07T04:00:24Z</lastChecked>
  </latestMonitoringStatus>
  <dcterms:created>2008-11-14T12:05:19Z</dcterms:created>
  <monitoring xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4/monitoring" resourceType="Service">
    <tests>
      <serviceTest xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_tests/7" resourceType="ServiceTest">
        <testType>
          <urlMonitor>
            <url>http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ws/services/WSDbfetch</url>
            <resource xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_deployments/4" ...></resource>
          </urlMonitor>
        </testType>
        <dcterms:created>2010-03-09T10:52:00Z</dcterms:created>
        ...
      </serviceTest>
      ...
    </tests>
  </monitoring>
  <related>
    ...
  </related>
</service>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4/monitoring.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "service": {
        "name": "DBFetch",
        "self": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4",
        "service_tests": [
            {
                "service_test": {
                    "status": {
                        "message": "The last check for this test was successful",
                        "symbol": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/images/tick-sphere-50.png",
                        "small_symbol": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/images/small-tick-sphere-50.png",
                        "last_checked": "2010-05-17T04:00:24Z",
                        "label": "PASSED"
                    },
                    "test_type": {
                        "url_monitor": {
                            "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_deployments/4",
                            "url": "http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ws/services/WSDbfetch"
                        }
                    },
                    "self": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_tests/7",
                    "created_at": "2010-03-09T10:52:00Z"
                }
            },
            ...
        ],
        ...
    }
}

GET /services/{id}/annotations

Annotations on a specific Service.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4/annotations.xml

Redirects to: http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations.xml?as=%5b4%5d

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<annotations xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations?as=%5B4%5D" ...>
  <parameters>
    <filters>
      <group name="Annotatables">
        <type name="Services" urlKey="as" description="">
          <filter urlValue="4">DBFetch</filter>
        </type>
      </group>
    </filters>
    <sortBy urlKey="sort_by" urlValue="created">Created at date</sortBy>
    <sortOrder urlKey="sort_order" urlValue="desc">Descending</sortOrder>
    <page urlKey="page">1</page>
    <pageSize urlKey="per_page">10</pageSize>
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    <pages>3</pages>
    <results>23</results>
    <total>19432</total>
  </statistics>
  <results>
    <annotation xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations/48393" resourceType="Annotation">
      <annotatable xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4" resourceName="DBFetch".../>
      <source xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/259" .../>
      <version>1</version>
      <annotationAttribute xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotation_attributes/3" resourceType="AnnotationAttribute">
        <dc:title>Annotation Attribute - http://biocatalogue.org/attribute/alternativeName</dc:title>
        <name>alternative_name</name>
        <dc:identifier>http://biocatalogue.org/attribute/alternativeName</dc:identifier>
      </annotationAttribute>
      <value>
        <type>String</type>
        <content>WSDbfetch (SOAP)</content>
      </value>
      <dcterms:created>2010-03-08T11:46:58Z</dcterms:created>
    </annotation>
    ...
  </results>
  <related>
    ...
  </related>
</annotations>

Back to Table of Endpoints

GET /service_deployments/{id}

Details about a specific ServiceDeployment.

A ServiceDeployment is a particular running instance of the service that provides either the SoapService or RestService, and that is managed by a ServiceProvider. The data model allows for multiple ServiceDeployments, akin to service mirrors, by multiple ServiceProviders.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_deployments/4.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<serviceDeployment xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_deployments/4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"...>
  <endpoint>http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ws/services/WSDbfetch</endpoint>
  <serviceProvider xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_providers/1" ...>
    <dc:title>Service Provider - European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI)</dc:title>
    <name>European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI)</name>
    ...
  </serviceProvider>
  <location>
    <city></city>
    <country>United Kingdom</country>
    ...
  </location>
  ...
  <providedVariant>
    <soapService xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services/4" resourceType="SoapService" xlink:title="Soap Service - WSDBFetchServerLegacyService">
      <dc:title>Soap Service - WSDBFetchServerLegacyService</dc:title>
      <name>WSDBFetchServerLegacyService</name>
      ...
    </soapService>
  </providedVariant>
  <ancestors>
    <service xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4" resourceName="DBFetch" ...></service>
  </ancestors>
  <related>
    ...
  </related>
</serviceDeployment>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_deployments/4.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "service_deployment": {
        "self": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_deployments/4",
        "provided_variant": {
            "name": "WSDBFetchServerLegacyService",
            "submitter": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/26",
            "documentation_url": "http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/dbfetch",
            "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services/4",
            "wsdl_location": "http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/wsdl/WSDbfetch.wsdl",
            "description": "WSDbfetch: Database entry retrieval using entry identifiers (see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/dbfetch)",
            "created_at": "2008-11-14T12:05:15Z"
        },
        "submitter": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/26",
        "provider": {
            "name": "European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI)",
            "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_providers/1",
            "description": "The European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI) is a non-profit academic organisation that forms part of the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) ( http://www.embl.org/).\nThe EBI is a centre for research and services in bioinformatics. The Institute manages databases of biological data including nucleic acid, protein sequences and macromolecular structures."
        },
        "location": {
            "country_code": "GB",
            "city": null,
            "country": "United Kingdom",
            "flag": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/images/flags/gb.png"
        },
        "created_at": "2008-11-14T12:05:19Z",
        "endpoint": "http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ws/services/WSDbfetch"
    }
}

GET /soap_services

SoapServices index/collection resource.

A SoapService is the SOAP variant of a Service.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<soapServices xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services" ...>
  <parameters>
    ...
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    <pages>159</pages>
    <results>1583</results>
    <total>1583</total>
  </statistics>
  <results>
    <soapService xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services/2595" resourceType="SoapService" xlink:title="Soap Service - wsPrediction">
      <dc:title>Soap Service - wsPrediction</dc:title>
      <name>wsPrediction</name>
      <wsdlLocation>http://gmd.mpimp-golm.mpg.de/webservices/wsPrediction.asmx?WSDL</wsdlLocation>
      <submitter xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/527" resourceType="User" xlink:title="Member - Jan Hummel" resourceName="Jan Hummel"/>
      <dc:description>
These web services provide access to methods for prediction of chemical sub-groups by means of user submitted mass spectra.
Please send all feedback to &lt;a href="mailto:hummel@mpimp-golm.mpg.de"&gt;hummel@mpimp-golm.mpg.de&lt;/a&gt;</dc:description>
      <documentationUrl>http://gmd.mpimp-golm.mpg.de/webservices/wsPrediction.asmx</documentationUrl>
      <dcterms:created>2010-04-30T13:25:25Z</dcterms:created>
    </soapService>
    ...
    </results>
  <related>
    <next xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services?page=2" resourceType="RestMethods" xlink:title="Next page of results"/>
  </related>
</soapServices>

Back to Table of Endpoints

POST /soap_services

NOT YET LIVE

Submit a SOAP service to the BioCatalogue.

See the examples below on how to structure the request.

Note: This action requires authentication using your account credentials.

Currently only HTTP Basic authentication is supported. For more information on how to use HTTP Basic authentication, please see the following link: HTTP Basic info

Description of Attributes

The following briefly describes each attribute present in the example below.

Note: The ability to update service metadata is currently not yet implemented in the API, however annotations can be added at a later time by any user.

Attribute Description Required?
wsdl_location The URL to the WSDL document that describes this service. Yes
annotations A set of additional metadata to be attached to the service. The different classes of annotation are as follows No
- alternative_names A list of alternative names for the service. No
- categories A list of URLs to categories relevant to this service. A list of categories can be found here: http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories.xml No
- description A textual description of what the service does. No
- documentation_url A URL to some detailed documentation of the service. No
- tags A list of text tags relevant to the service. No

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services.xml

Submitting a SOAP service (XML): 

<soap_service>
    <wsdl_location>http://www.example.com/webservice.wsdl</wsdl_location>
    <annotations>
        <documentation_url>http://www.example.com/docs.html</documentation_url>
        <alternative_names type="array">
            <alternative_name>alternate name for this service</alternative_name>
            <alternative_name>yet another name for this service</alternative_name>
        </alternative_names>
        <tags type="array">
            <tag>example</tag>
            <tag>test</tag>
            <tag>delete me</tag>
        </tags>
        <description>Put a description of the web service here</description>
        <categories type="array">
            <category>http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories/1</category>
            <category>http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories/6</category>
            <category>http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories/17</category>
        </categories>
    </annotations>
</soap_service>

Submitting a SOAP service (JSON): 

{
  "soap_service" : {
    "wsdl_location" : "http://www.example.com/webservice.wsdl",
    "annotations" : {
      "documentation_url" : "http://www.example.com/docs.html",	
      "alternative_names" : ["alternate name for this service", "yet another name for web service"],
      "tags" : ["example", "test", "delete me"],
      "description" : "Put a description of the web service here",
      "categories" : ["http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories/1", "http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories/6", "http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories/17"]
    }
  }
}

Back to Table of Endpoints

GET /soap_services/wsdl_locations

The full list of WSDL locations in the BioCatalogue.

This is a convenience method.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services/wsdl_locations.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<wsdlLocations xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services/wsdl_locations" ...>
  <wsdlLocation>http://134.169.104.13/webservice/prodoric.wsdl</wsdlLocation>
  <wsdlLocation>http://134.169.104.13/webservice/systomonas.wsdl</wsdlLocation>
  <wsdlLocation>http://api-v3-1.cathdb.info/static/wsdl/DataServices.wsdl</wsdlLocation>
  <wsdlLocation>http://api.bioinfo.no/wsdl/Blast.wsdl</wsdlLocation>
  ...
</wsdlLocations>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services/wsdl_locations.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "wsdl_locations": [
        "http://134.169.104.13/webservice/prodoric.wsdl",
        "http://134.169.104.13/webservice/systomonas.wsdl",
        "http://api-v3-1.cathdb.info/static/wsdl/DataServices.wsdl",
        "http://api.bioinfo.no/wsdl/Blast.wsdl",
        ...
    ]
}

GET /soap_services/{id}

Details about a specific SoapService variant.

A SoapService is the SOAP variant of a Service.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services/4.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<soapService resourceType="SoapService" ...>
  <dc:title>Soap Service - WSDBFetchServerLegacyService</dc:title>
  <name>WSDBFetchServerLegacyService</name>
  <wsdlLocation>http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/wsdl/WSDbfetch.wsdl</wsdlLocation>
  ...
  <deployments resourceType="SoapService" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services/4/deployments">
    ...
  </deployments>
  <operations resourceType="SoapService" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services/4/operations">
    <soapOperation resourceType="SoapOperation" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_operations/12" xlink:title="Soap Operation - fetchBatch">
      <dc:title>Soap Operation - fetchBatch</dc:title>
      <name>fetchBatch</name>
      <dc:description>Get a set of database entries (see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/dbfetch#fetchbatch_db_ids_format_style)</dc:description>
      <parameterOrder>db ids format style</parameterOrder>
      <dcterms:created>2008-11-14T12:05:16Z</dcterms:created>
    </soapOperation>
    ...
  </operations>
  <ancestors>
    <service resourceType="Service" ...></service>
  </ancestors>
  <related>
    ...
  </related>
</soapService>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services/4.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "soap_service": {
        "name": "WSDBFetchServerLegacyService",
        "self": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services/4",
        "operations": [
            {
                "name": "fetchBatch",
                "parameter_order": "db ids format style",
                "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_operations/12",
                "description": "Get a set of database entries (see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/dbfetch#fetchbatch_db_ids_format_style)",
                "created_at": "2008-11-14T12:05:16Z"
            },
            ...
        ],
        "documentation_url": "http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/dbfetch",
        "wsdl_location": "http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/wsdl/WSDbfetch.wsdl",
        "description": "WSDbfetch: Database entry retrieval using entry identifiers (see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/dbfetch)",
        "created_at": "2008-11-14T12:05:15Z"
    }
}

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services/4/annotations.xml

Redirects to: http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations.xml?ass=%5b4%5d

Output Snippet (XML):

  <parameters>
    <filters>
      <group name="Annotatables">
        <type name="SOAP Services" urlKey="ass" description="">
          <filter urlValue="4">WSDBFetchServerLegacyService</filter>
        </type>
      </group>
    </filters>
    <sortBy urlKey="sort_by" urlValue="created">Created at date</sortBy>
    ...
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    <pages>1</pages>
    <results>4</results>
    <total>19432</total>
  </statistics>
  <results>
    <annotation resourceType="Annotation" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations/45714">
      <annotatable resourceType="SoapService" resourceName="WSDBFetchServerLegacyService" .../>
      <source resourceType="User" resourceName="Franck Tanoh" .../>
      <version>1</version>
      ...
      <value>
        <type>String</type>
        <content>
          ...
        </content>
      </value>
      <dcterms:created>2009-07-30T14:56:04Z</dcterms:created>
    </annotation>
    ...
  </results>
  <related>
    <filters resourceType="Filters" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations/filters" .../>
  </related>
</annotations>

GET /soap_operations

SoapOperations index/collection resource.

A SoapOperation is a SOAP operation for a particular SoapService.

    ...

  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    ...
    <total>8777</total>
  </statistics>
  <results>
    <soapOperation xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_operations/16466" resourceType="SoapOperation" ...>
      <dc:title>Soap Operation - palindrome</dc:title>
      <name>palindrome</name>
      <dc:description></dc:description>
      <parameterOrder></parameterOrder>
      <dcterms:created>2010-04-04T16:42:26Z</dcterms:created>

        <inputs xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_operations/16466/inputs" resourceType="SoapOperation" .../>
        <outputs xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_operations/16466/outputs" resourceType="SoapOperation" .../>
        ...
      </related>
    </soapOperation>
    ...
  </results>
  <related>
    ...
  </related>
</soapOperations>

Back to Table of Endpoints

GET /soap_operations/filters

Filters that can be applied to the SoapOperations index. These include filters for tags on inputs and outputs.

Key Filters By
tag_ops Tags (on Operations)
tag_ins Tags (on Inputs)
tag_outs Tags (on Outputs)

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_operations/filters.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<filters xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/SoapOperations/filters" ...>
  <group name="Tags">
    <type name="Tags" urlKey="tag" description="">
      <filter name="&lt;http://www.mygrid.org.uk/mygrid-moby-service#simpleParameter&gt;" ... resourceType="SoapOperations" count="21">
      </filter>
      ...
    </type>
  </group>
  <group name="Tags (on Operations)">
    ...
  </group>
  <group name="Tags (on Inputs)">
    ...
  </group>
  <group name="Tags (on Outputs)">
    ...
  </group>
</filters>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_operations/filters.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

[
    {
        "group": {
            "filter_types": [
                {
                    "filter_type": {
                        "name": "Tags",
                        "filters": [
                            {
                                "filter": {
                                    "name": "<http://www.mygrid.org.uk/ontology#DDBJ>",
                                    "id": "<http://www.mygrid.org.uk/ontology#DDBJ>",
                                    "count": 23
                                }
                            },
                            {
                                "filter": {
                                    "name": "<http://www.mygrid.org.uk/ontology#retrieving>",
                                    "id": "<http://www.mygrid.org.uk/ontology#retrieving>",
                                    "count": 21
                                }
                            },
                            ...
                        ],
                        "description": "",
                        "url_key": "tag"
                    }
                }
            ],
            "name": "Tags"
        }
    },
    ...
]

GET /soap_operations/{id}

Details about a specific SoapOperation.

A SoapOperation is a SOAP operation for a particular SoapService.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_operations/12.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<soapOperation xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_operations/12" ...>
  <dc:title>Soap Operation - fetchBatch</dc:title>
  <name>fetchBatch</name>
  ...
  <inputs xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_operations/12/inputs" resourceType="SoapOperation">
    <soapInput xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_inputs/15" resourceType="SoapInput" xlink:title="Soap Input - db">
      <dc:title>Soap Input - db</dc:title>
      <name>db</name>
      <dc:description></dc:description>
      <computationalType>xsd:string</computationalType>
      <computationalTypeDetails></computationalTypeDetails>
      <dcterms:created>2008-11-14T12:05:16Z</dcterms:created>
    </soapInput>
    ...
  </inputs>
  <outputs xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_operations/12/outputs" resourceType="SoapOperation">
    ...
  </outputs>
  <ancestors>
    ...
  </ancestors>
  <related>
    ...
  </related>
</soapOperation>

Output Snippet (JSON):

    "soap_operation": {
        "name": "fetchBatch",

                "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_inputs/15",
                "description": "input description here test",
                "created_at": "2008-11-14T12:05:16Z"
            },
            ...
        ],
        "parameter_order": "db ids format style",
        "description": "Get a set of database entries (see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/dbfetch#fetchbatch_db_ids_format_style)",

            {
                "name": "fetchBatchReturn",
                "computational_type": "xsd:string",
                "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_outputs/12",
                "description": "Returns your entries in specified format. Generally this will contain only one item which contains the set of entries.",
                "created_at": "2008-11-14T12:05:17Z"
            }
        ],
        "created_at": "2008-11-14T12:05:16Z"

GET /soap_inputs/{id}

Details about a specific SoapInput.

A SoapInput is a SOAP input for a particular SoapOperation.

Example

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<soapInput xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_inputs/15" ...>
  <dc:title>Soap Input - db</dc:title>
  <name>db</name>
  <dc:description></dc:description>
  <computationalType>xsd:string</computationalType>
  <computationalTypeDetails></computationalTypeDetails>
  <dcterms:created>2008-11-14T12:05:16Z</dcterms:created>
  <ancestors>
    <service xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/4" ... resourceName="DBFetch"></service>
    <soapService xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services/4" ... resourceName="WSDBFetchServerLegacyService"></soapService>
    <soapOperation xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_operations/12" ... resourceName="fetchBatch"></soapOperation>
  </ancestors>
  <related>
    <annotations ...  resourceType="Annotations" xlink:title="All annotations on this SOAP Input"/>
  </related>
</soapInput>

GET /soap_outputs/{id}

Details about a specific SoapOutput.

A SoapOutput is a SOAP output for a particular SoapOperation.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_outputs/13.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<soapOutput resourceType="SoapOutput" ...>
  <dc:title>Soap Output - getSupportedDBsReturn</dc:title>
  <name>getSupportedDBsReturn</name>
  <dc:description></dc:description>
  <computationalType>impl:ArrayOf_xsd_string</computationalType>
  <computationalTypeDetails></computationalTypeDetails>
  <dcterms:created>2008-11-14T12:05:17Z</dcterms:created>
  <ancestors>
    <service ... resourceName="DBFetch"></service>
    <soapService resourceType="SoapService" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_services/4" xlink:title="The parent SOAP Service that this SOAP Output - getSupportedDBsReturn - belongs to" resourceName="WSDBFetchServerLegacyService"></soapService>
    <soapOperation ... resourceName="getSupportedDBs"></soapOperation>
  </ancestors>
  <related>
    <annotations resourceType="Annotations" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_outputs/13/annotations" xlink:title="All annotations on this SOAP Output"/>
  </related>
</soapOutput>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_outputs/13.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "soap_output": {
        "computational_type": "impl:ArrayOf_xsd_string",

        "self": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_outputs/13",
        "description": "Returns format names. ",
        "created_at": "2008-11-14T12:05:17Z"
    }
}

  </results>
  <related>
    <filters ... xlink:title="Filters for the annotations index"/>
    <filtersOnCurrentResults ... resourceType="Filters" .../>
  </related>
</annotations>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/soap_outputs/13/annotations.json

Redirects to: http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations.json?asout=%5b13%5d

Back to Table of Endpoints

POST /rest_services

NOT YET LIVE

Submit a REST service to the BioCatalogue.

See the examples below on how to structure the request.

Note: This action requires authentication using your account credentials.

Currently only HTTP Basic authentication is supported. For more information on how to use HTTP Basic authentication, please see the following link: HTTP Basic info

Description of Attributes

The following briefly describes each attribute present in the example below.

Note: The ability to update service metadata is currently not yet implemented in the API, however annotations can be added at a later time by any user.

Attribute Description Required?
name The name of the service. Yes
endpoint The base/root endpoint of the service. Yes
rest_resources A list of endpoints relevant to this service. See below. No
annotations A set of additional metadata to be attached to the service. The different classes of annotation are as follows No
- alternative_names A list of alternative names for the service. No
- categories A list of URLs to categories relevant to this service. A list of categories can be found here: http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories.xml No
- description A textual description of what the service does. No
- documentation_url A URL to some detailed documentation of the service. No
- tags A list of text tags relevant to the service. No

REST Resources

Each endpoint should consist of a string containing:

  • the relevant HTTP verb (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.)
  • a space
  • the URL of the endpoint, including the base endpoint, with any URL parameters marked with an identifier surrounded by curly braces - {}

For example, the endpoint: 

GET http://www.example.com/search.php?query={query_string}

would accept an HTTP GET request to the following example URL: 

http://www.example.com/search.php?query=higgs+boson

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_services.xml

Submitting a REST service (XML): 

<rest_service>
    <name>Example Service</name>
    <endpoint>http://www.example.com</endpoint>
    <rest_resources type="array">
        <rest_resource>POST http://www.example.com/examples</rest_resource>
        <rest_resource>GET http://www.example.com/examples</rest_resource>
        <rest_resource>GET http://www.example.com/examples/{id}</rest_resource>
        <rest_resource>PUT http://www.example.com/examples/{id}</rest_resource>
        <rest_resource>DELETE http://www.example.com/examples/{id}</rest_resource>
        <rest_resource>GET http://www.example.com/search.php?query={query_string}</rest_resource>
    </rest_resources>    
    <annotations>
        <documentation_url>http://www.example.com/docs.html</documentation_url>
        <alternative_names type="array">
            <alternative_name>alternate name for this service</alternative_name>
            <alternative_name>yet another name for this service</alternative_name>
        </alternative_names>
        <tags type="array">
            <tag>example</tag>
            <tag>test</tag>
            <tag>delete me</tag>
        </tags>
        <description>Put a description of the web service here</description>
        <categories type="array">
            <category>http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories/1</category>
            <category>http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories/6</category>
            <category>http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories/17</category>
        </categories>
    </annotations>
</rest_service>

Submitting a REST service (JSON): 

{
  "rest_service" : {
    "name" : "Example REST service",
    "endpoint" : "http://www.example.com",
    "rest_resources" : [
        "POST http://www.example.com/examples",
        "GET http://www.example.com/examples",
        "GET http://www.example.com/examples/{id}",
        "PUT http://www.example.com/examples/{id}",
        "DELETE http://www.example.com/examples/{id}",
        "GET http://www.example.com/search.php?query={query_string}"],
    "annotations" : {
      "documentation_url" : "http://www.example.com/docs.html",	
      "alternative_names" : ["alternate name for web service", "yet another name for web service"],
      "tags" : ["example", "test", "delete me"],
      "description" : "Put a description of the web service here",
      "categories" : ["http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories/1", "http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories/6", "http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories/17"]
    }
  }
}

Details about a specific RestService variant.

A RestService is the REST variant of a Service.

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<restService ...>
  <dc:title>Rest Service - WSDbfetch</dc:title>
  <name>WSDbfetch</name>
  <submitter resourceName="Franck Tanoh" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/27" resourceType="User" xlink:title="Member - Franck Tanoh"/>
  <dc:description></dc:description>
  <documentationUrl>http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/dbfetch_rest</documentationUrl>
  <dcterms:created>2009-04-22T13:41:48Z</dcterms:created>
  <deployments xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_services/2/deployments" resourceType="RestService">
    <serviceDeployment xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_deployments/608" resourceType="ServiceDeployment">
        ...
    </serviceDeployment>
  </deployments>
  <resources xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_services/2/resources" resourceType="RestService">
    <restResource xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_resources/5" resourceType="RestResource" xlink:title="Rest Resource - /{db}/{id}">
      <dc:title>Rest Resource - /{db}/{id}</dc:title>
      <path>/{db}/{id}</path>
      <submitter resourceName="Eric Nzuobontane" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/2" resourceType="User" xlink:title="Member - Eric Nzuobontane"/>
      <dcterms:created>2010-04-19T16:13:21Z</dcterms:created>
    </restResource>
  </resources>
  <ancestors>
    ...
  </ancestors>
  <related>
    ...
  </related>
</restService>

RestResources index/collection resource.

    <page urlKey="page">1</page>
    <pageSize urlKey="per_page">10</pageSize>
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    <pages>9</pages>
    <results>82</results>
    <total>82</total>
  </statistics>
  <results>
    <restResource xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_resources/101" resourceType="RestResource" xlink:title="Rest Resource - /search">
      <dc:title>Rest Resource - /search</dc:title>
      <path>/search</path>
      <submitter xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/14" resourceType="User" xlink:title="Member - Jiten Bhagat" resourceName="Jiten Bhagat"/>
      <dcterms:created>2010-06-29T10:23:42Z</dcterms:created>
    </restResource>
    ...
  </results>
  <related>
    <next xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_resources?page=2" resourceType="RestResources" xlink:title="Next page of results"/>
  </related>
</restResources>

GET /rest_resources/{id}/annotations

Annotations on a specific RestResource.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_resources/99/annotations.xml

Redirects to: http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations.xml?arres=%5B99%5D

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<annotations xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations?arres=%5B99%5D" ...>
  <parameters>
    <filters>
      <group name="Annotatables">
        <type name="REST Resources" urlKey="arres" description="">
          <filter urlValue="99">/concepts/leafpath/{ontologyVersionId}/{conceptId}</filter>
        </type>
      </group>
    </filters>
    <sortBy urlValue="created" urlKey="sort_by">Created at date</sortBy>
    <sortOrder urlValue="desc" urlKey="sort_order">Descending</sortOrder>
    <page urlKey="page">1</page>
    <pageSize urlKey="per_page">10</pageSize>
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    <pages>0</pages>
    <results>0</results>
    <total>19792</total>
  </statistics>
  <results>
  </results>
  <related>
    <filters xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations/filters" resourceType="Filters" xlink:title="Filters for the annotations index"/>
    <filtersOnCurrentResults xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations/filters?arres=%5B99%5D" resourceType="Filters" xlink:title="Filters for the annotations index that will be applied on top of the current results set"/>
  </related>
</annotations>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_resources/99/annotations.json

Back to Table of Endpoints

GET /rest_methods/filters

Filters that can be applied to the RestMethods index.

Key Filters By
tag_rms Tags (on REST Methods)
tag_ins Tags (on Inputs)
tag_outs Tags (on Outputs)

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_methods/filters.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<filters xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/RestMethods/filters" ...>
  <group name="Tags">
    <type name="Tags" urlKey="tag" description="">
      <filter xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_methods?tag=%5B%3Chttp%3A%2F%2Fwww.mygrid.org.uk%2Fontology%23DDBJ_accession%3E%5D" count="6" urlValue="&lt;http://www.mygrid.org.uk/ontology#DDBJ_accession&gt;" name="&lt;http://www.mygrid.org.uk/ontology#DDBJ_accession&gt;" xlink:title="Filter by tag: '&lt;http://www.mygrid.org.uk/ontology#DDBJ_accession&gt;'" resourceType="RestMethods">
      </filter>
      <filter xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_methods?tag=%5Bfeature%5D" count="4" urlValue="feature" name="feature" xlink:title="Filter by tag: 'feature'" resourceType="RestMethods">
      </filter>
      ...
    </type>
  </group>
  ...
</filters>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_methods/filters.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

[
    {
        "group": {
            "filter_types": [
                {
                    "filter_type": {
                        "name": "Tags",
                        "filters": [
                            {
                                "filter": {
                                    "name": "<http://www.mygrid.org.uk/ontology#DDBJ_accession>",
                                    "id": "<http://www.mygrid.org.uk/ontology#DDBJ_accession>",
                                    "count": 6
                                }
                            },
                            {
                                "filter": {
                                    "name": "feature",
                                    "id": "feature",
                                    "count": 4
                                }
                            },
                            ...
                        ],
                        "description": "",
                        "url_key": "tag"
                    }
                }
            ],
            "name": "Tags"
        }
    },
    ...
]

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_methods/84/annotations.xml

Redirects to: http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations.xml?arm=%5B84%5D

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<annotations xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations?arm=%5B84%5D" ...>
  <parameters>
    <filters>
      <group name="Annotatables">
        <type name="REST Methods" urlKey="arm" description="">
          <filter urlValue="84">Get paths to leaves from a concept in a specific ontology version</filter>
        </type>
      </group>
    </filters>
    <sortBy urlValue="created" urlKey="sort_by">Created at date</sortBy>
    <sortOrder urlValue="desc" urlKey="sort_order">Descending</sortOrder>
    <page urlKey="page">1</page>
    <pageSize urlKey="per_page">10</pageSize>
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    <pages>0</pages>
    <results>0</results>
    <total>19792</total>
  </statistics>
  <results>
  </results>
  <related>
    <filters xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations/filters" resourceType="Filters" xlink:title="Filters for the annotations index"/>
    <filtersOnCurrentResults xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations/filters?arm=%5B84%5D" resourceType="Filters" xlink:title="Filters for the annotations index that will be applied on top of the current results set"/>
  </related>
</annotations>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_methods/84/annotations.json

Redirects to: http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations.json?arm=%5B84%5D

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "annotations": {
        "results": [
 
        ],
        "sort_order": "desc",
        "sort_by": "created",
        "total": 0,
        "per_page": 10,
        "search_query": null,
        "pages": 0,
        "current_page": 1
    }
}

  <defaultValue></defaultValue>
  <paramStyle>query</paramStyle>
  <isOptional>false</isOptional>
  <constrainedValues>
  </constrainedValues>

  <dcterms:created>2010-04-26T16:02:33Z</dcterms:created>
  <ancestors>

GET /rest_parameters/{id}/annotations

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_parameters/12/annotations.xml

Redirects to: http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations.xml?arp=%5B12%5D

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<annotations xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations?arp=%5B12%5D" resourceType="Annotations" ...>
  <parameters>
    <filters>
      <group name="Annotatables">
        <type name="REST Parameters" urlKey="arp" description="">
          <filter urlValue="12">accession</filter>
        </type>
      </group>
    </filters>
    <sortBy urlValue="created" urlKey="sort_by">Created at date</sortBy>
    <sortOrder urlValue="desc" urlKey="sort_order">Descending</sortOrder>
    <page urlKey="page">1</page>
    <pageSize urlKey="per_page">10</pageSize>
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    <pages>1</pages>
    <results>3</results>
    <total>19790</total>
  </statistics>
  <results>
    <annotation xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations/51944" resourceType="Annotation">
      <annotatable xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/rest_parameters/12" resourceType="RestParameter" resourceName="accession" xlink:title="The thing that this annotation is about"/>
      <source xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/27" resourceType="User" resourceName="Franck Tanoh" xlink:title="The source of this annotation (i.e.: the person, registry, etc that this annotation came from)."/>
      <version>1</version>
      <annotationAttribute xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotation_attributes/5" resourceType="AnnotationAttribute">
        <dc:title>Annotation Attribute - http://biocatalogue.org/attribute/exampleData</dc:title>
        <name>example_data</name>
        <dc:identifier>http://biocatalogue.org/attribute/exampleData</dc:identifier>
      </annotationAttribute>
      <value>
        <type>String</type>
        <content>AB000050</content>
      </value>
      <dcterms:created>2010-04-26T16:33:15Z</dcterms:created>
    </annotation>
    ...
  </results>
  <related>
    ...
  </related>
</annotations>

Back to Table of Endpoints

GET /service_tests/{id}

Details about a specific ServiceTest.

A ServiceTest is a particular test configured for a Service in order to carry out monitoring of that Service. This abstracts out what the test actually does, thus allowing different types of monitoring tests to be handled in a consistent manner.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_tests/5.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<serviceTest resourceType="ServiceTest" ...>
  <testType>
    <urlMonitor>
      <url>http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/es/ws-servers/WSCensor</url>
      <resource resourceType="ServiceDeployment" ...></resource>
    </urlMonitor>
  </testType>
  <dcterms:created>2010-03-09T10:51:56Z</dcterms:created>
  <latestStatus>
    <label>PASSED</label>
    <message>The last check for this test was successful</message>
    ...
  </latestStatus>
  <ancestors>
    <service resourceName="WSCensorService" ...></service>
  </ancestors>
  <related>
    <results resourceType="TestResults" .../>
  </related>
</serviceTest>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_tests/5.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "service_test": {
        "test_type": {
            "url_monitor": {
                "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_deployments/3",
                "url": "http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/es/ws-servers/WSCensor"
            }
        },
        "status": {
            "message": "The last check for this test was successful",
            "symbol": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/images/tick-sphere-50.png",
            "small_symbol": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/images/small-tick-sphere-50.png",
            "last_checked": "2010-05-17T04:00:24Z",
            "label": "PASSED"
        },
        "self": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_tests/5",
        "created_at": "2010-03-09T10:51:56Z"
    }
}

Back to Table of Endpoints

GET /service_tests/{id}/results

Monitoring TestResults for a specific ServiceTest.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_tests/5/results.xml

Redirects to: http://www.biocatalogue.org/test_results.xml?service_test_id=5

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<testResults ...>
  <parameters>
    <sortBy urlValue="created" urlKey="sort_by">Created at date</sortBy>
    <sortOrder urlValue="desc" urlKey="sort_order">Descending</sortOrder>
    ...
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    <pages>43</pages>
    <results>421</results>
    <total>960947</total>
  </statistics>
  <results>
    <testResult ... resourceType="TestResult">
      <testAction>soap_fault</testAction>
      <resultCode>0</resultCode>
      <dcterms:created>2010-04-07T04:00:24Z</dcterms:created>
      <status>
        <label>PASSED</label>
        ...
      </status>
      <ancestors>
        ...
      </ancestors>
      <related></related>
    </testResult>
    ...
  </results>
  <related>
    <next .../>
  </related>
</testResults>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_tests/5/results.json

                    "label": "PASSED"
                },

                "test_action": "soap_fault",
                "result_code": 0,
                "created_at": "2010-05-17T04:00:24Z"
            },
            ...
        ],
        "sort_order": "desc",
        "sort_by": "created",
        "total": 461,
        "per_page": 10,
        "search_query": null,
        "pages": 47,
        "current_page": 1

GET /test_results

TestResults index/collection resource.

A TestResult is a particular result of the execution of a ServiceTest. This provides a common results model that isn't dependant on the type of test carried out.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/test_results.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<testResults ...>
  <parameters>
    ...
    <pageSize urlKey="per_page">10</pageSize>
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    <pages>96095</pages>
    ...
  </statistics>
  <results>
    <testResult xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/test_results/963049" resourceType="TestResult">
      <testAction>http_head</testAction>
      <resultCode>0</resultCode>
      <dcterms:created>2010-04-07T04:42:45Z</dcterms:created>
      <status>
        <label>PASSED</label>
        <message>This check was successful</message>
        <symbol .../>
        <smallSymbol .../>
        <lastChecked>2010-04-07T04:42:45Z</lastChecked>
      </status>
      <ancestors>
        <service xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/2623" ...></service>
        <serviceTest xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_tests/3942" ...></serviceTest>
      </ancestors>
      <related></related>
      ...
    </results>
    <related>
      <next xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/test_results?page=2" resourceType="TestResults" xlink:title="Next page of results"/>
    </related>
  </testResults>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/test_results.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "test_results": {
        "results": [
            {
                "status": {
                    "message": "This check was successful",
                    "symbol": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/images/tick-sphere-50.png",
                    "small_symbol": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/images/small-tick-sphere-50.png",
                    "last_checked": "2010-05-17T04:47:26Z",
                    "label": "PASSED"
                },
                "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/test_results/1116790",
                "test_action": "http_head",
                "result_code": 0,
                "created_at": "2010-05-17T04:47:26Z"
            },
            ...
        ],
        "sort_order": "desc",
        "sort_by": "created",

        "per_page": 10,
        "search_query": null,
        "pages": 110994,
        "current_page": 1

GET /categories

Categories index/collection resource.

A Category is an abstraction over category annotations, this is a particular service category from the service categories controlled vocabulary.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<categories ...>
  <parameters>
    <rootsOnly urlKey="roots_only">true</rootsOnly>
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    <pages>1</pages>
    <results>11</results>
    <total>60</total>
  </statistics>
  <results>
    <category resourceType="Category" ... xlink:title="Category - Sequence Analysis">
      <dc:title>Category - Sequence Analysis</dc:title>
      <name>Sequence Analysis</name>
      <totalItemsCount>138</totalItemsCount>
      <related>
        <services resourceType="Services" .../>
      </related>
    </category>
    ...
  </results>
  <related>
    <serviceFilters resourceType="Filters" .../>
  </related>
</categories>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "categories": {
        "results": [
            {
                "name": "Sequence Analysis",
                "total_items_count": 146,
                "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories/1"
            },
            {
                "name": "Protein Sequence Analysis",
                "total_items_count": 114,
                "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories/2"
            },
            ...
        ],
        "total": 60,
        "per_page": 10,
        "search_query": null,
        "pages": 6,
        "current_page": 1
    }
}

      <totalItemsCount>111</totalItemsCount>

      </related>
    </service>

  </results>

    ...
  </related>

GET /tags

Tags index/collection resource. Can be used to build tag clouds / lists.

A Tag is an abstraction over tag annotations, that allows building of tag clouds and searching by tags.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/tags.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<tags ...>
  <parameters>
    <sort urlKey="sort" urlValue="counts">Counts</sort>
    ...
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    ...  </statistics>
  <results>
    <tag ... resourceType="Tag" ...>
      <dc:title>Tag - &lt;http://www.mygrid.org.uk/mygrid-moby-service#simpleParameter&gt;</dc:title>
      <name>&lt;http://www.mygrid.org.uk/mygrid-moby-service#simpleParameter&gt;</name>
      <displayName>simpleParameter</displayName>
      <totalItemsCount>1203</totalItemsCount>
      <related>
        ...
      </related>
    </tag>
    ...
  </results>
  <related>
    <next xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/tags?page=2" resourceType="Tags" xlink:title="Next page of results"/>
  </related>
</tags>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/tags.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "tags": {
        "results": [
            {
                "name": "BioMoby",
                "total_items_count": 749,
                "display_name": "BioMoby"
            },
            ...
        ],
        "total": 864,
        "per_page": 10,
        "search_query": null,
        "pages": 87,
        "current_page": 1
    }
}

Back to Table of Endpoints

GET /tags/{tagname}

Details about a specific Tag.

A Tag is an abstraction over tag annotations, that allows building of tag clouds and searching by tags.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/tags/biology.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<tag resourceType="Tag" ...>
  <dc:title>Tag - biology</dc:title>
  <name>biology</name>
  <displayName>biology</displayName>
  <totalItemsCount>100</totalItemsCount>
  <related>
    ...
  </related>
</tag>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/tags/biology.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "tag": {
        "name": "biology",
        "total_items_count": 100,
        "display_name": "biology"
    }
}

Back to Table of Endpoints

GET /tags/{tagname}?namespace={namespace}

Details about a specific Tag that comes from a controlled vocabulary (currently only supports tags from the myGrid ontology).

A Tag is an abstraction over tag annotations, that allows building of tag clouds and searching by tags.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/tags/simpleParameter.xml?namespace=mygrid-service-ontology

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<tag ...>
  <dc:title>Tag - <http://www.mygrid.org.uk/mygrid-moby-service#simpleParameter></dc:title>
  <name><http://www.mygrid.org.uk/mygrid-moby-service#simpleParameter></name>
  <displayName>simpleParameter</displayName>
  <totalItemsCount>1203</totalItemsCount>
  <related>
    ...
  </related>
</tag>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/tags/simpleParameter.json?namespace=mygrid-service-ontology

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "tag": {
        "name": "<http://www.mygrid.org.uk/mygrid-moby-service#simpleParameter>",
        "total_items_count": 0,
        "display_name": "simpleParameter"
    }
}

Back to Table of Endpoints

GET /service_providers

ServiceProviders index/collection resource.

A ServiceProvider is a particular provider of ServiceDeployments.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_providers.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<serviceProviders ...>
  <parameters>
    ...
    <pageSize urlKey="per_page">10</pageSize>
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    ...
    <total>222</total>
  </statistics>
  <results>
    <serviceProvider resourceType="ServiceProvider" ...>
      <dc:title>Service Provider - www-pathwaycommons-org</dc:title>
      <name>www-pathwaycommons-org</name>
      <dc:description></dc:description>
      <dcterms:created>2010-03-24T11:16:49Z</dcterms:created>
      <related>
        ...
      </related>
    </serviceProvider>
    ...
  </results>
  <related>
    <next resourceType="ServiceProviders" ... xlink:title="Next page of results"/>
  </related>
</serviceProviders>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/service_providers.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "service_providers": {

            },
            {
                "name": "Pathway Commons",

                "description": null
            }...
        ],

        "sort_by": "created",
        "total": 114,
        "per_page": 10,
        "search_query": null,
        "pages": 12,
        "current_page": 1
    }

GET /users

Users index/collection resource.

A User is a registered user of the BioCatalogue, who can submit services, contribute annotations and so on. In the web interface, Users are referred to as Members. This is to distinguish between anonymous users and registered users.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/users.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<users ...>
  <parameters>
    ... 
    <pageSize urlKey="per_page">10</pageSize>
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    ...
    <total>378</total>
  </statistics>
  <results>
    <user resourceType="User" ... xlink:title="Member - xxxxx">
      <dc:title>Member - xxxxx</dc:title>
      <name>xxxxx</name>
      <affiliation></affiliation>
      <location>
        <city></city>
        <country>xxxxx</country>
        ...      
      </location>
      <publicEmail></publicEmail>
      <joined>2010-04-07T13:31:07Z</joined>
      <related>
        ...
      </related>
    </user>
    ...
  </results>
  <related>
    ...
  </related>
</users>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/users.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "users": {
        "results": [
            {
                "name": "mannie",
                "joined": "2010-06-03T09:53:02Z",
                "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/537",
                "public_email": "",
                "affiliation": "",
                "location": {
                    "city": "",
                    "country_code": null,
                    "country": "",
                    "flag": ""
                }
            },
            ...
        ],
        "sort_order": "desc",
        "sort_by": "activated",
        "total": 351,
        "per_page": 10,
        "search_query": null,
        "pages": 36,
        "current_page": 1
    }
}

Back to Table of Endpoints

GET /users/filters

Filters that can be applied to the Users index.

Key Filters By
c Country (Location)

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/filters.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<filters xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/Users/filters" resourceType="Filters" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.biocatalogue.org/2009/xml/rest http://www.biocatalogue.org/2009/xml/rest/schema-v1.xsd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" for="Users" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="http://www.biocatalogue.org/2009/xml/rest" xmlns:dcterms="http://purl.org/dc/terms/">
  <group name="Locations">
    <type name="Countries" urlKey="c" description="">
      ...
      <filter urlValue="United Kingdom" xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/users?c=%5BUnited+Kingdom%5D" count="82" resourceType="Users" name="United Kingdom" xlink:title="Filter by country: 'United Kingdom'">
      </filter>
      ...
    </type>
  </group>
</filters>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/filters.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

[
    {
        "group": {
            "filter_types": [
                {
                    "filter_type": {
                        "name": "Countries",
                        "filters": [
                            {
                                "filter": {
                                    "name": "(unknown)",
                                    "id": "(unknown)",
                                    "count": 176
                                }
                            },
                            ...
                        ],
                        "description": "",
                        "url_key": "c"
                    }
                }
            ],
            "name": "Locations"
        }
    }
]

GET /users/{id}

A User is a registered user of the BioCatalogue, who can submit services, contribute annotations and so on. In the web interface, Users are referred to as Members. This is to distinguish between anonymous users and registered users.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/27.xml

  <location>
    <city></city>
    <country>United Kingdom</country>
    ...
  </location>
  <publicEmail>ytanoh@cs.man.ac.uk</publicEmail>
  <joined>2008-11-18T14:45:50Z</joined>
  <related>
    ...
  </related>
</user>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/27.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "user": {
        "name": "Franck Tanoh",
        "self": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/27",
        "joined": "2008-11-18T14:45:50Z",

        "affiliation": "University of Manchester",

            "country_code": "GB",
