GET /registries

Registries index/collection resource (other registries that the BioCatalogue sources services and annotations from).

A Registry is an external registry or portal that is used as a source of services and/or annotations.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/registries.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<registries resourceType="Registries" ... xmlns:dcterms="http://purl.org/dc/terms/">
  <parameters>
    <sortBy urlKey="sort_by" urlValue="created">Created at date</sortBy>
    <sortOrder urlKey="sort_order" urlValue="desc">Descending</sortOrder>
    <page urlKey="page">1</page>
    <pageSize urlKey="per_page">10</pageSize>
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    <pages>1</pages>
    <results>3</results>
    <total>3</total>
  </statistics>
  <results>
    <registry resourceType="Registry" ... xlink:title="Registry - The EMBRACE Registry">
      <dc:title>Registry - The EMBRACE Registry</dc:title>
      <name>The EMBRACE Registry</name>
      <dc:description></dc:description>
      <homepage>http://www.embraceregistry.net/</homepage>
      <dcterms:created>2009-06-26T10:58:15Z</dcterms:created>
      <related>
        <annotationsBy resourceType="Annotations" .../>
        <services resourceType="Services" .../>
      </related>
    </registry>
    ...
  </results>
  <related>
  </related>
</registries>

        "sort_by": "created",

        "pages": 1,
        "current_page": 1

GET /agents

Agents index/collection resource.

An Agent is an automated entity that can perform actions within the BioCatalogue, such as creating annotations and performing automated curation.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/agents.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<agents ...>
  <parameters>
    <sortBy urlKey="sort_by" urlValue="created">Created at date</sortBy>
    <sortOrder urlKey="sort_order" urlValue="desc">Descending</sortOrder>
    <page urlKey="page">1</page>
    <pageSize urlKey="per_page">10</pageSize>
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    <pages>1</pages>
    <results>1</results>
    <total>1</total>
  </statistics>
  <results>
    <agent xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/agents/1" resourceType="Agent" xlink:title="Agent - BioCatalogue">
      <dc:title>Agent - BioCatalogue</dc:title>
      <name>BioCatalogue</name>
      <dc:description></dc:description>
      <dcterms:created>2009-06-25T11:40:08Z</dcterms:created>
      <related>
        <annotationsBy ... resourceType="Annotations" xlink:title="All annotations by this Agent"/>
      </related>
    </agent>
  </results>
  <related>
  </related>
</agents>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/agents.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "agents": {
        "results": [
            {
                "name": "BioCatalogue",
                "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/agents/1",
                "description": null,
                "created_at": "2009-06-25T11:40:08Z"
            }
        ],
        "sort_order": "desc",
        "sort_by": "created",
        "total": 1,
        "per_page": 10,
        "search_query": null,
        "pages": 1,
        "current_page": 1
    }
}

GET /annotation_attributes

AnnotationAttributes index/collection resource.

An AnnotationAttribute is a particular class/type/group of Annotations. For example, tag, description, etc. This allows for an extensible data model for metadata.

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotation_attributes.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<annotationAttributes ...>
  <parameters>
    <page urlKey="page">1</page>
    <pageSize urlKey="per_page">10</pageSize>
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    <pages>3</pages>
    <results>30</results>
    <total>30</total>
  </statistics>
  <results>
    <annotationAttribute resourceType="AnnotationAttribute" xlink:...>
      <dc:title>Annotation Attribute - http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/description</dc:title>
      <name>Description</name>
      <dc:identifier>http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/description</dc:identifier>
    </annotationAttribute>
    ...
  </results>
  <related>
    <next resourceType="AnnotationAttributes" ... xlink:title="Next page of results"/>
  </related>
</annotationAttributes>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotation_attributes.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

{
    "annotation_attributes": {
        "results": [
            {
                "name": "Description",
                "resource": "http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotation_attributes/1",

            },
            {
                "name": "Tag",

        "search_query": null,
        "pages": 4,
        "current_page": 1
    }

An AnnotationAttribute is a particular class/type/group of Annotations. For example, tag, description, etc. This allows for an extensible data model for metadata.

  <name>Description</name>
  <dc:identifier>http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/description</dc:identifier>
  <related>
    <annotations resourceType="Annotations" ... xlink:title="All annotations for the attribute 'http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/description'"/>
  </related>
</annotationAttribute>

        "name": "Description",

GET /annotations

Annotations index/collection resource.

Annotations are the extensible mechanism by which additional metadata is added about Services (or their constituents) in the BioCatalogue, to incrementally document services at various levels of granularities (e.g. tags, categories, etc).

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations.xml

Output Snippet (XML):

    <pageSize urlKey="per_page">10</pageSize>
  </parameters>
  <statistics>
    <pages>1944</pages>
    <results>19432</results>
    <total>19432</total>
  </statistics>
  <results>
    <annotation xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations/51843" resourceType="Annotation">
      <annotatable ... resourceType="Service" xlink:title="The thing that this annotation is about" resourceName="G-language SOAP Service"/>
      ...
      <value>
        <resource xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories/56" resourceType="Category" .../>
        <type>Category</type>
        <content>Biostatistics</content>
      </value>
      <dcterms:created>2010-04-04T16:42:35Z</dcterms:created>
    </annotation>
    ...
  </results>
  <related>
    ...
  </related>
</annotations>

GET /annotations/filters

Filters that can be applied to the Annotations index. These include filters for the sources and attributes.

Key Filters By
attrib Annotation Attributes
as Services
asd Service Deployments
asp Service Providers
ars REST Services
arres REST Resources
arm REST Methods
arp REST Parameters
arr REST Representations
ass SOAP Services
asop SOAP Operations
asin SOAP Inputs
asout SOAP Outputs
soa Agents (Source)
sor Registries (Source)
sosp Service Providers (Source)
sou Users (Source)

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations/filters.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<filters resourceType="Filters" ...>
  <group name="Annotation Attributes">
    <type name="Annotation Attributes" description="" urlKey="attrib">
      <filter resourceType="Annotations" ... xlink:title="Filter by annotation attribute: 'http://biocatalogue.org/attribute/tag'" count="7662" urlValue="2">
      </filter>
      ...
    </type>
  </group>
  ...
</filters>

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations/filters.json

Output Snippet (JSON): 

[
    {
        "group": {
            "filter_types": [
                {
                    "filter_type": {
                        "name": "Annotation Attributes",
                        "filters": [
                            {
                                "filter": {
                                    "name": "http://biocatalogue.org/attribute/tag",
                                    "id": "2",
                                    "count": 6893
                                }
                            },
                            ...
                        ],
                        ...
                    },
                    ...
                },
                ...
            ],
            ...,
        },
    }, 
    ...
]

Back to Table of Endpoints

GET /annotations/{id}

Details about a specific Annotation.

Annotations are the extensible mechanism by which additional metadata is added about Services (or their constituents) in the BioCatalogue, to incrementally document services at various levels of granularities (e.g. tags, categories, etc).

Example

URL: http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotations/51843.xml

Output Snippet (XML): 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<annotation ...>
  <annotatable xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/services/2623" resourceType="Service" xlink:title="The thing that this annotation is about" resourceName="G-language SOAP Service"/>
  <source xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/users/105" resourceType="User" xlink:title="The source of this annotation (i.e.: the person, registry, etc that this annotation came from)." resourceName="cory"/>
  <version>1</version>
  <annotationAttribute xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/annotation_attributes/51" resourceType="AnnotationAttribute">
    <dc:title>Annotation Attribute - http://biocatalogue.org/attribute/category</dc:title>
    <name>category</name>
    <dc:identifier>http://biocatalogue.org/attribute/category</dc:identifier>
  </annotationAttribute>
  <value>
    <resource xlink:href="http://www.biocatalogue.org/categories/56" resourceType="Category" xlink:title="The resource (if any) that the value of this annotation refers to" resourceName="Biostatistics"/>
    <type>Category</type>
